definition[0]: to agree to leave your position or to stop trying to be elected, so that someone else can have a chance
example[0]: He was obliged to stand down as a parliamentary candidate.
definition[1]: to leave the witness box in a court of law
definition[2]: if a soldier stands down or is stood down, he stops working for the day
definition[3]: to agree to leave your position or stop trying to be elected, so that someone else can have a chance
